title.narrative: Engaging Pvt. Sectr in Tomato Valu Chain

description.narrative: Engaging Private Sector in Tomato Value Chain in Thatta Project Information: The proposed PDI project supported by Oxfam Novib aimsat developing and strengthening linkages between the small farmers and private sector in tomato value chain with a view to increasethe income and strengthen sustainable livelihood of small farmers including women farmers and generate employment opportunities forthe unemployed rural youth. In addition it proposes to engage in policy dialogue and advocacy on the policy flaws which are hampering the greater contribution of private sector in tomato value chain in Sindh Pakistan. Engaging the private sector in vegetables especially tomato value chain. Objectives: Enhance the engagement of private sector with small farmers and their support in tomato value chain in Thatta district, Sindh. Engage in policy advocacy for creating an enabling environment for increased engagement and support of private sector to tomato value chain. Project Area All the community based activities will be conducted in Mirpur Sakro tehsilof District Thatta while the advocacy initiatives will be undertaken in major cities like Thatta, Hyderabad, Karachi and Islamabad Activities under Specific Objective -1 Strengthen the existing Farmers Organizations and Producer Organizations in Thatta district already established through Oxfam Novib support under Livelihoods and Adaptation programme. Organize trainings for the members of Farmers /Producer Organizations on standards and tractability in agriculture produces to pave ways for value chain links with private sector. Organize trainings for the members of Famers / Producer Organizations engagement / contract / MOU terms including production specifications, pricing and payment structures for beneficial engagement with private sector in value chain. Conduct a study on tomato value chain potential in district Thatta including mapping of private sector tomato value chain actors. Organize farmers seminarsfor the private sector agencies and experts to directly interact with farmers imparting them latest knowledge and skills on best agriculture practices on vegetable especially tomato value chain. Distribute valuable literature and Screen documentaries of differentprivate sector companies in the farmers gatherings in the project villages on vegetable especially tomato value chain. Facilitatingthe visits of the experts of different private sector agencies to the farmers for improving crop produce and marketing. Activities under Specific Objective:2 Organizing meeting with the private sector entities to motivate them for engaging with the farmers and taking part in tomato value chain in Thatta district. Preparation of Policy papers on role of private sector in vegetable seed development, issues in the establishment of private sector markets and issues in private sector financing for agriculture value chain. Organizing a Provincial Level Consultative Workshop on Enabling Environment for the Participation of Private Sector in Tomato Value Chain. Sharing all the policy papers and policy briefs with the policy makers, private sector agencies / leaders and other key stakeholders. Writing letters to policy makers, government officials and heads of different concerned departments. Writing articles in newspapers about the importance of vegetable value chain and issue in the participation of the private sector in value chain. Organizing Media briefings /press conferences on the basis of the policy papers / consultative workshop recommendations. Organize Round table forum at National Level to ensure strong coordination and linkages between different actors in Agriculture Value Chain in Pakistan.

participating-org.narrative:
Participatory Development Initiative [PDI] was launched on January 29, 2000 by a group of young community development professionals, human rights activists, trade unionists, researchers, media professionals, political activists and concerned citizens it is registered under Societies Registration Act 1860. PDI is engaged in community awareness, mass mobilization, participatory community development participatory research, advocacy, campaigning and networking on the local, national as well as global issuesnegatively affecting the lives and the livelihoods of the poor communities.
PDI is established engaging itself for promoting participatory, pro-poor,environment friendly, sustainable, and gender balanced development, for creating equal opportunities and benefits for all the communities of the deprived parts of the country.
Vision PDI envisions a participatory development process with the active involvement of all the stakeholders, right from the conceptualization to planning and implementation phases, making the development process people- oriented, people -centered, and gender sensitive
Mission Promoting participatory, pro-poor, environment friendly, sustainable, and gender balanced development, for creating equal opportunities and benefits for all.
Objectives •Mobilizing and organizing the local communities to empower them to take initiatives for their equal and active participation in the development process •Building the capacities of the local communities/ community organizations todevelop their organizational strength and leadership skills •Promoting sustainable livelihoods, community based natural resource management and disaster risk management and mitigation, education and health through community awareness and community baseddevelopment processes •Engaging in awareness, mobilization and policy advocacyon the local, national and international socio-economic, policies, plans, programs and projects affecting the poor communities, their lives and livelihoods Conducting communitybased participatory research, information and knowledge sharing and networking to strengthen the civil society partnerships and alliance building for participatory and sustainable development. The local communities mobilized and organized by PDI are playing greater role in the development of their respective communities
PDI has developed programme activities on Community mobilisation, Climate Change <(>&<)> DRR, Programs, Humanitarian response, Community Infrastructure development, Health and WatSan, education and literacy, youth and gender, CSR, economic literacy, CS networking and Research and Monitoring <(>&<)> Evaluation.
PDI works in Sindh and Balochistan provinces. Presently, the organization is directly working with the local communities in 10 districts (Karachi, Thatta, Badin, Hyderabad, Tando Allahyar, Sanghar, Umerkot, Mithi, Mirpurkhas and Dadu) of Sindhand 8 districts (Quetta, Ziarat, Kalat, Khuzdar, Awaran, Lasbela, Kech [Turbat] and Gwadar) of Balochistan. However, PDI Advocacy Programs/ Campaigns have national, regional as well as international scope and audience.
PDI has partnerships with: Actionaid International Pakistan, Government of Sindh, IFAD, Oxfam GB/OI,UNDP, UN HABITAT, WWF Pakistan, Youth Action Net and Youth Service America
